Detailed Description

template<typename Type>
class Path< Type >

A template class which allows one to define an arbitrary path to be moved along over a given time interval. To use, first define the start and end times. Then add all of the points on your path, evenly spaced out. If you want it to be cyclic, use makeCyclic(), otherwise don't. Now, to find out where it is on the path at the current time, simply use getPoint().

The type of path used can be any element for which addition, subtraction, scalar multiplication, and scalar division have been overloaded. Some examples that would make good paths would include double, Point2, Point3.

Definition at line 27 of file path.h.

template<typename Type>
Path< Type >::Path (  )  [inline]

Default constructor.

The default constructor sets startTime and endTime to zero, and isCyclic to false.

template<typename Type>
void Path< Type >::makeCyclic (  )  [inline]

Make the path cyclic.

This function will cause the path to repeat itself, so that when it reaches the end of the path, it starts over at the beginning.

Definition at line 134 of file path.h.

00134                             {
00135     isCyclic = true;
00136 }

template<typename Type>
void Path< Type >::unMakeCyclic (  )  [inline]

Make the path non-cyclic.

This function will cause the path to be non-repeating, so that once endTime is reached, the point stops moving. This is the default behaviour of the class.

Definition at line 144 of file path.h.

00144                               {
00145     isCyclic = false;

template<typename Type>

Get the point at the current time.

Use this function to find out where in the path your point currently lies (at the current time).

Returns:
returns the current location along the path.

template<typename Type>
Type Path< Type >::getPoint ( int  time  )  [inline]

Get the point at the specified time.

Use this function to find out where in the path your point lies (at the given time).

Parameters:
time is the time at which you wish to find the points location.
Returns:
returns the location along the path at time.

00167                                   {
00168     if (points.size() == 0) {
00169         return Type(0,0,0);
00170     }
00171 
00172     int timeRange = endTime - startTime;
00173     int timeLocation = 0;
00174 
00175     if (isCyclic) {
00176         timeLocation = (time - startTime) % timeRange;
00177     } else {
00178         timeLocation = (time - startTime);
00179     }
00180 
00181     double timeStep = (double)timeRange/(points.size() - 1*(!isCyclic));
00182 
00183     if (timeLocation < 0) {
00184         return points[0];
00185     } else if (timeLocation > endTime) {
00186         return points[points.size() - 1];
00187     } else {
00188         double numSteps = (double)timeLocation / timeStep;
00189         int beforeIndex = floor(numSteps);
00190         int afterIndex = ceil(numSteps);
00191         if (afterIndex >= points.size()) {
00192             afterIndex = 0;
00193         }
00194         return points[beforeIndex] + (points[afterIndex] - points[beforeIndex])*(numSteps - beforeIndex);
00195     }
00196 }
